Reviews.Title: “No surprises :)”
Reviews.Author: Revitalka
Reviews.Content: It was OK, exactly what we expected from the price. Location was a bonus, since it's close to the train and buses. No need for more then that if you spend all your time outside and come to the hotel for a few hours of sleep at night. The staff was super nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So helpful!”
Reviews.Author: adriana k
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Rome when i went on the school trip, and they were so helpful to me, Ronaldo and Mohumed assisted me and they were the nicest hotel manager/worker that I encounted on my stay in Italy. The hotel itself is clean and has beautiful views in a great street next to the main strip with lots of little cafe`s and resturants around. I recommend this hotel for anyone going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: chuong_p
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to termini station but was a decent walk from the main attractions. Pros: clean rooms, breakfast included, good price for Rome with private ensuite, and friendly staff. Cons: very small room and bathroom, no a/c, no hot water at night, lack of water during some periods of the day, no safe, and very outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: f2tenchi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during my week visit to Roma. Very nice hotel, if you plan to running around the Roma and them come back to calm and nice place for sleep that is your hotel. very friendly staff, good breakfasts. very good located, 10 minutes by walk to railway station, and 15 minutes to Coleseo and Piazza Vinezia. when i will go to Roma again on the next year i plan to stay in this hotel !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome will go back”
Reviews.Author: Alexander351
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Hotel Clarin from 7th to 11th June 2011. The hotel is very basic but clean and friendly staff. Very well placed for a base. Continental breakfast was adequate. If you want a clean place to simply put your head down, it will fit the bill. Many cafes close to the hotel and even an Irish Bar at the top of VIa Nacionale. One important warning. we bought a 1 Euro ticket for the bus to go to St. Peters. These tickets are valid for 75 minutes. We got a number 64 and when it stopped we were amazed at how packed it was. We managed to squeeze on and two stops later some more people got on. There were two inspectors and when we produced our tickets we were escorted off the bus and fined 100 euros because we had not validated them when we got on. We did not know that we had to but even if we had, we could not reach the machine because of the crowd in the bus. The inspector pretended to be sympathetic because we were tourists but he insisted that he had to fine us. He offered to settle for 50 euros each if we paid on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean”
Reviews.Author: Lualy
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel I was a bit unsure of the hotel as you have to buzz to get in and the hotel is up on the second floor but it seems like its up higher as there are lots of steps. The elevator is like a lift from a 100 years ago and we got a great laugh off it when we saw it first. Despite the initial unsureness our room was spacious, although the bathroom was small. It was very clean and the room was serviced daily with fresh towels provided. The staff were friendly especially the older man who despite having very little english and us having very little italian, was very helpful and was always cheerful and smiling. The location of this hotel is perfect and is very near the train and metro and we had no problem getting around. A few mins walk to the colleseum, trevi fountain and pantheon. The only downpoint is that the breakfast was terrible with very little choice. I would recommend it to a friend if they were looking for somewhere ideally located but didn't want to spend a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “very nice location and services!”
Reviews.Author: damadistratta
Reviews.Content: i've been in clarin hotel a few months ago.. it vas a very nice trip! the location of the hotel was very usefull to go all around the city, and it was very easy to approach al the main bus and train stations. the people at the reception were very kind for each request, and at our disposal really 24 hurs! the rooms were clean and quite. very nice hotel i reccomand you for your journy, with family, friends or partner!

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to sleep in Rome. Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: ventoshe
Reviews.Content: If you need a place to sleep in Rome, this is a great value for your money. Great location, very simple and clean. Don't expect any luxury, but a convenient place for a good sleep after a long day in Rome. And hey, this is a LOT!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but hotel has some issues.”
Reviews.Author: K_Q_10
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It's on a nice quiet street close to lots of attractions. The room was small but nicely finished. The shower is narrow enough that you can't touch your toes. No air conditioning. The "free" internet requires you to pay a one time registration fee. And then we discovered there is only wi-fi reception in some of the rooms. Some of the staff didn't speak English, but they were quite friendly. We managed some communication with Mohammed using some broken French, and he ended up helping find a nice restaurant (actually walked us over there). We were traveling with a group of friends and booked three rooms. At first we had three side by side. The toilet didn't work in one room, so they were moved to another room. Our second last day there, while we were out, our friends in the three-person room had all their stuff moved into a smaller room, because the manager was under the impression that two of the roommates had checked out, and they were over booked. The smaller room was the size of a closet and had a little single bed. As a result my partner and I ended up taking a cot into our room so our other friend would have someplace to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Myut
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights, and it isn't exactly the best hotel I've stayed in. It's quite weird with the door phone (the hotel is on the 2nd floor, so you have to ring the bell and ask to be let inside), and the receptionist sounded really angry when we rang the doorbell the first time to check in. But the rest of the stay they were kind enough. The room was tiny, but it was clean, so it worked well. Sadly there wasn't any aircondition so I definitely wouldn't stay there in the mid of the summer! The good thing is that the window was facing towards a shady courtyard so we didn't overheat in spite of the missing aircon. The shower was really bad and very small, but at least it was clean. If you're a light sleeper, then this is definitely not the place to stay! You can easily hear every time people walk pass your door early in the morning even if they're just talking quietly. Okay, not that many good things to say about the hotel really, though my friend said that the breakfast was quite good. The really good thing about the hotel was the location! You can walk anywhere, and besides that there's a Spar supermarket just around the corner, which is very handy in an otherwise expensive city. So 3 stars because of the location and the cleanliness. You get what you pay for. Oh, and Rome is wonderful. I recommend a trip in the hop-on-hop-off-city-bus. It's 15 euro, but great value for the money. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, small and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: frishki
Reviews.Content: The two of us booked this hotel with a flight over one web site for less than $600 for three nights, including flights from Zagreb, Croatia and for that kind of money I must admit, I don't believe you can do better. Hotel is situated some 700-800 meters from Termini Station and right next to Via Nazionale where many bus lines go through. Many tourists attractions, museums and churches are in the walking distance, but you could also take the bus or the metro. Room was quite small, but clean, with TV and a bathroom. The hotel is on the second floor of the building and you can take a very old (and small) elevator or just walk. The interior is pretty basic and cheap looking but for that kind of money I don't think you could ask for more. The staff is pretty nice, but some of them barely speak any English. You can purchase the Wi-Fi access code on the reception desk for €5 and use the computer that is in the lobby or your own laptop. The signal isn't that strong to use it outside the lobby, but we managed to catch it in our room. The connection was breaking from time to time, but we couldn't complain. We had a breakfast buffet every morning and the choice wasn't that great, but you can eat something just for to start the day in the city. All in all, we are pretty pleased what we got for our money and would recommend it to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bring your own towels”
Reviews.Author: Taschira
Reviews.Content: The nice staff and good location close to Via Nazionale and Piazza della Republica make up for crappy towels and a shower that takes 10 minutes to get hot. For breakfast I'd suggest a bar close by. Overall it's a good and fairly priced pick for your short city trip.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Annette1966
Reviews.Content: I booked a twin room for me and my daughter, we got a double room. The tv remote was redundant as ther was only 1 chanel, cartoons in Italian. The lift was marginally better than useless. Where was the bar? I couldn't stop scratching and found i had been bitten during the first night. Staff less than helpful. Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “The Clarin Hotel is terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Utexasgirl01
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a favor, do not stay at The Clarin Hotel! We couldn't even stay there one night! We knew it was not good when no cab drivers had ever heard of it out of about 5 of them that we talked to at the train station. The cab driver we had only found out after calling his company and them looking it up. So, we get there and it says it is on the second story, which we thoght was odd. So, we attempt to get in the tiny elevator and it is broken. We get up to the hotel and we immediately notice one thing-the smell! It smells absolutely horrible! Like mold and smoke! We reluctantly go to check out our room and it stinks horribly, as well! We have honestly never smelled anything so horrible. We asked for a Queen and twin bed and there are three twin beds in our room. The bathroom is tiny with the smallest shower I have ever seen. My Husband sees a whole bunch of mold on the top of the toilet. We leave to find another hotel and end up being able to get a room at a great place just up the street. We go back to talk to the guy at the front desk at The Clarin and it was interesting. We had hoped since we hadn't even been there for 30 minutes he would let us go with just paying our depsoit. Nope. He wanted the deposit and two nights stay! Even after we told him how much it stinks and is dirty and does not look like the brochure at all! We argued with him for a bit, he said he was calling the cops if we didn't pay deposit and two nights, so we gave it to him. I said sir, it is amazing that we just wasted $300 dollars to check out this horrible place and were not even here for 30 minutes. Oh well. Just please do not stay here! It is terrible!

Reviews.Title: “It's was fair for the price. Aware your expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ZedaBrasil
Reviews.Content: Well, to begin, you have to be aware of the first traveling room. Watch for your expectations. If you are looking for luxury and confort it may not be this one. It has a regular room, regular staff, regular meals, and a panthografic elevator for 2 peopel only. if you are traveling with lots of luggages watch out, you have to make in a 5 ways to the room or carry trough the stairs. If you are looking for a budget/location trip, its perfect. It not a "TERRIBLE" hotel like almost everybody are saying in the reviews. They problably got astonished by the pictures and had a desilusion. Its an average hotel. The expectations are the key to have a nice stay. Average rooms, average staff and great prices. Its located near the principal street, and have the most terrifc place to eat pizza ans pasta in rome on the corner, but i forgot its name. It appears in one of the pictures of the hotel in the "tripadvisor hotel pictures". Luxury, dont go there. Budget and Location. Its the right place. Aware the expectations!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with perfect location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Mary_G26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a two star hotel in the very centre. It is perfect in tems of location if you want to dicscover the most of Rome and Italy. Stazione Termini is just 10 min walk from there. The Central line station Piazza de Republica is just 5 min walk. You should not expect the luxiary rooms. They are very simple. They are clean, causy and large. The staff is excellent. The employees are always to give you good advice and offer help, very friendly, indeed. We would consider it if we travel to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay more than 1 night!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RCHLN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awful, I booked it as a treat for me & my partner, she was soooooo excited. But when we got there she refused to stay any more than 1 night. It was dirty, cramped, the ‘eating area’ was….well just that I wouldn’t call it a ‘breakfast room’. Our room was small the ‘shower’ was rubbish…… need I go on. After 1 night we booked out & spent the rest our stay in Rome in the Hotel Artemide, which was great…..but quite a lot more expensive!!!! Rome – We loved the city. I could write all day about it, but I’m sure you all know just how lovely & interesting the city is…….& for my partner………… well St Peters & the Vatican was a dream. Lovely would recommend it to any couple.

Reviews.Title: “hated it”
Reviews.Author: cccdddeee
Reviews.Content: Very Basic hotel , yes .. but i d rather sleep on a bed of nails, close to all the sights but its not an oasis by far !!!!! you feel dirty going there. rude staff do not stay here !!! 2 floors up , door sticks and you cant get in at night , rubbish breakfast Shower blocked up .. so you have to stop washing , smallest shower in the world . they only accept cash payment even though it may be booked via another website (dodgey and poor buisness practice ., nearly went to the police (if i spoke Italian) , all smoke in reception even though it is a non smoking hotel. Bunch of [--]

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away. Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Jeves
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor, and stay away from the Hotel Clarin. We had to lug our luggage up 3 levels (It seems in Rome that "level 2" is always level 3, because the reception area is considered "level 0." ) When you walk in, the first thing you notice is the overwhelming smell of sewage. Very damp, and you had to plug your nose to actually get through the smell. I did not trust the elavator to bring you up to the floor - it appeared to be as old as the Coliseum. Reception area: We checked in with a white haired fella named Marco (I believe that was his name) and he was the only helpful receptionist - every other receptionist was not pleasant. I felt like I was a burden to them. We booked this place because it was moderately cheap (90 Euro) but when we got in and checked in, suddenly it was 100 Euro. We stayed in the Hotel Clarin for 3 nights, before taking off for Florence, Tuscany, etc - our plan was to stay in this place the night before our flight - we cancelled that last night after they tried to charge us 120 Euro for the last night. Rooms: When we booked, we thought "We are going to be out sightseeing, so all we need is a place to sleep, so let's go cheap, we will never be there anyway." - NEVER AGAIN, and I highly suggest that you don't think that way, either. (Pay the extra bucks to get a 3 star, so you can get a moderately good nights' sleep, so you can enjoy the next day) The rooms were appalling - I can't describe how uncomfortable the beds were - I could feel every spring in my back, and every morning I woke up sore, after a sleepless night, whether it was from the "bed" or from the 24-7 traffic right outside your window, or the crazies aimlessly wandering around at 3 in the morning making noise, or my personal favorite - every morning about 2 am, a business establishment in the area would decide to throw its day's worth of bottles into the metal garbage can, making a thunderous clatter that woke us up every night. Bathroom: I can sum this up very easy with my shower experience. First off, the shower is something that I could barely fit in, let alone shower adequately. The shower was seriously 24" x 24" - and after the first morning, my wife showered, and noticed that the bottom of the shower was filling up, and not draining properly - the next morning, I experienced the same thing, so upon further examination, I took a Q Tip, pried open the drain to expose about 200 years of old nasty hairball that just about made me gag. Summary: This is very easy - STAY AWAY. I have stayed in a lot of hotels, and this place was right at the top as being the worst. Between the nasty smell when you walk in, the unpleasant receptionists, the terrible beds, getting waked up at 3 in the morning by loud clatter and traffic, and then getting our pricing mysteriously increased - Just stay away. What a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby!”
Reviews.Author: cariadcher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the station which is Ok but it is on the 2nd floor and you have to go up in a sort of 'cage' The hallway does not give a very good impression and is very shabby. Once you reach the hotel itself the whole thing has an air of scruffiness-- The 'breakfast area' is just behing the check in desk with the men smoking YUK. The room itself was not very nice-- not sure who took the photos on the web site but they do give a rather good impression of a very shabby hotel.There is a much nicer one about 100 m down the road!

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: exaandt
Reviews.Content: nightmare as soon as you arrive, hotel is on second floor and you have to use a very old lift to reach second floor.Hotel is clean but i need of renovation the room we had was outward facing so looked on to street some looked over a shut in courtyard try and get a out looking room.Rooms very basic but clean hotel staff seemed frendly until we needed to checkout then they tried to rip us off saying they hadnt been payed (even though we used a hotel voucher printed fom internet) so they swiped my card but my credit card company refused ,which we only found out when we got back.Also booked a cab through them to go back to airport and we asked driver how much he wrote 30 euros but when we got to airport he wanted 50 so we had to call over a policeman who told him to go away .The free breakfast is a experiance fun though in a strange way.Try and find another hotel do not book here ,although the area was nice and local resturants very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo89
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel if you don't want to afford high prices and search for a good location. We stayed in a four people room, that had 2 big beds.

Reviews.Title: “Simply convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Funky_gal17
Reviews.Content: Hotel Clarin was alright. It was 30-minute walk from the Roma Termini Station. It's on the lane parallel to Via Nazionale where you can get easy access to buses, metros and eatery places. Room was clean, so were the sheets. Fresh towels everyday. Breakfast was simple croissant, cereal and coffee. The drawback was that the hotel was on the second floor as we had big luggages, and the walls were thin, so we really had to tone down our voices! Otherwise, it is good for budget travellers, but not recommended to those with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Read Their Fine Print Before You Book!!!! Do Not Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: AprilH
Reviews.Content: I booked a room there for two nights over 4th of July weekend. I ended up cancelling that reservation the same day. The hotel decided to wait EIGHT DAYS (THEIR COMPUTER WAS SUPPOSEDLY DOWN FOR THOSE EIGHT DAYS) before contacting me to tell me that I had booked this room through another website (which I did not) and that I would be charged 156 euro as a 'no show'. I am currently in the middle of getting this dispute resolved with these people at this hotel through my credit card. I have gotten rude emails from these people at this hotel daring me to 'prove it' that I did book this hotel through them. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!! FROM THE PICTURES POSTED ON THE NET OF THE ROOMS AT THIS HOTEL, I'M GLAD I DECIDED TO STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: lojack
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights in January and found the Clarin represented excellent value for money at the time. Its probably overpriced in the summer.Location is near perfection and a very short walk from the station. Continental breakfast was as you may expect,small but adequate and the dining area cosy;as are the rooms. There was adequate heat and blankets for winter.In fact it was T-shirt weather most days anyway. The entrance and old fashioned windows were quirky .Yes the front door feels intimitating at night but only the first time you go to use it.The lift is antique but overall these things add to the experience and bring back fond memories.When I return its definately the Clarin for me.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Clarin is the prefect Hotel for those wanting to experience Rome on a budget. It is a gentle 10min walk from Roma Termini & centrally located relative to all you would like to see whilst in Rome. We went with our 2 children (girls 4 & 2). The staff were great, the rooms were basic (it is 2 star after all) but were perfectly clean. Within leass than a minute or so walk are some great Pizzeria, Cafes, Bars & Trattoria. I would certainly go there again & would not hesitate to suggest others looking to "keep it real" do the same. The money you save per night you can spend on a delicious meal & a few drinks. Good Luck Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Basic and cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights in late July 2004. On arrival, the lift did not work and when had to carry our luggage up several flights of stairs. We asked the night manager if the lift ever worked and he said that it didnt. He was unresponsive and at first seemingly rude. We found out the next morning that the lift did in fact work. The room was quite disappointing at first. It was small - we had 5 people staying in one room and there were 3 single beds and one double bed all pushed together so basically, it was a slab of mattresses. The bathroom was similarly small and at one stage our shower did not work. However, the small fan in the room did manage to cool us down quite abit at night and it wasn't very noisy at all even with the window open. The linen and floors were clean even though there was some ants around the room, though those disappeared after our first day there. The main manager was very friendly and helpful. He answered all our questions well and helped arrange a day tour for us. The night manager improved during our stay there. He became quite friendly and jovial as we saw him more. The breakfast left much to be desired - crisp bread and watered down, strange juice isn't much of a meal but it was enough to get us through until lunch time. The best part of this hotel is the location. Buses run along Via Nazionale all day and night and so its only a 1 minute walk home. The bus stops right near the entrance to Via Venezia along Via Nazionale so it is very convenient. It is also a short walk (5-10mins) to the metro. Overall, it was a cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Scary, but clean”
Reviews.Author: Traveler80401
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Clarin for 1 night in June (booked by a travel agent) as we arrived by train and left the next morning by plane. Hotel is close to Termini, but not when you're dragging several bags. Walking through the front door was an adventure as there is a high step to drag your bags over and a very small elevator to take you and your luggage up to the hotel on the third floor. This was the only 2* I stayed in during my 3 weeks in Italy, so I was surprised by how basic it was. I must say that while the hotel is very hostel-like, at least it was clean. The staff was very helpful, as I called a few days before arriving to schedule 2 early taxis for the airport. The clerk spoke excellent English and the taxis arrived as scheduled. I would suggest that persons not used to a hostel style atmosphere look elsewhere, but the Clarin was adequate for what I needed. I agree with the other reviewers that the breakfast was somewhat lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Bad 2star hotels”
Reviews.Author: smilec
Reviews.Content: I had been to this hotel 13 days ago.. the so called 2 stars hotel is really really terrible that i never ever seen. I reached there at night, when found the hotel is like haunted mansion, the main entrance door is huge and big, after u step in the haunted feeling is strong coz the hotel is at 4th Floor, empty at the "lobby"... the room No aircond doesn't matter but the fan is real small and u won't feel windy at all. The bed is not comfortable, no blanket as other hotels given, just give u a piece of cloth..wat happen if weather change cold? The bathroom is real small which u shower also feel so narrow. The breakfast was bad!!!!! as the other mentioned just 2 hard breads with some jam, real bad! so called Orange Juice u dun taste orange...waterly. ..disgusting juice. The receptionist is not friendly and helpful at all! I found that Rome is nice for travel but the people is not friendly & helpful at all. sigh...... If next time i come to Rome again, i'll never ever stay in Clarin Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was the worst hotel ive stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Stevie_g6
Reviews.Content: well its the worst hotel ive ever been in in my life!!! our room was small and grubby. there were wires hangin out of the wall and the view from the window was great (not!!!!!) a dirty court yard filled with tab ends and dirty clothes. the shower didnt work properly and it was hard to keep hot water and pressure for more than 5 mins. The breakfast consisted of french toast honey jam and some nutella!!! but there was a really nice breakfast place round the corner serving croissants and a range of drinks very nice!!! The only good thing about this hotel was its location 5 minutes from local metro republica and about 10-15 mins from termini station! i would not reccomend this hotel to anyone You could probably find another nicer hotel for the same price. But if you do decide to go have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I dont understand why this hotel got bad reveiws! The staff were really helpful and all of them spoke english. The room was really large, clean and comfy. The breakfast is very simple but if your on your way out to sightsee its at the right time to start the day off. The hotel is right in the center of all the famous sights and has plenty of places to eat around it. I really enjoyed my time at the hotel and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from the Clarin in Rome I am wondering where the people writing the other reviews have stayed. Whilst the hotel is basic (as I would expect for a 2* hotel) It was clean and bright. The fan in the room was more than enough for us even in the 36 degree heat of Rome in August. The bathroom had an adequate shower and was again cleaned daily by the friendly staff. The location is excellent and actually a 5-10 minute walk from the station if you find the right way. The staff were all helpful and made every effort to help us. Whilst some of them spoke limited English it is worth remembering that the hotel is in Italy and I'm sure there aren't many Italians who would stay in an English hotel and complain about the lack of Italian speaking staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as a base for a holiday exploring the delights Rome has to offer and also reccomend the excellent Pomo D'oro restaurant below the hotel. If, however you are looking to spend your holiday in a luxury suite rather than exploring this wonderful city then the Clarin is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “horrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dingy place, dingy view, lousy breakfast. Bad bathroom, no airconditioning and the weather was hot. One fan! One staff member not helpful another one not good English. Owner seemed ok. 2nd floor, lots of steps with cases, but lift ok and convenient area.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Slightly grubby, rather shabby with many things not really working. No toilet paper and a very poor breakfast. A good 10 to 15 minutes walk from the railway station. While not absolutely terrible there are many other places that offer better facilities for less money.

HotelInfo.Name: Clarin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palermo 36, 00184 Rome, Italy
